label: 蔵人頭
本: A Tale of Flowering Fortunes:  Annals of Japanese Aristocratic Life in the Heian Period (Volumes One and Two) . Stanford University Press . 1980
説明文: [Ranked b]elow the Superintendent [bettō], [the] two Head Chamberlains [were] in charge of day-to-day operations, one of whom was usually a Controller (Tō no Ben) and the other a Middle Captain in the Bodyguards (Tō no Chūjō).  They occupied the highest seats in the Courtiers' Hall, taking precedence even over men of superior rank (p. 817). [別当、頭弁、頭中将]
